Posts.Content: sandrav wrote: I am finished with 4 rounds of A/C and will be starting 12 rounds of taxol with herception.  We have a warm up over the weekend and there were times I literally felt sick like I was going to pass out, and throw up. I am so dreading the summer. I do have a air conditioner and drink lots of water, but will have to argue with my husband about the temperature. I think I know who will win, its definitely the one going through the treatments. How are you doing?  christianflockforums.com Diagnosed : December 24 2011~ IDC ~ 6cm, Stage 2. 0/0 nodes~ Bilateral MX January 6,2012 ~ER+/PR+, HER2, : 03/09/2012 Cytoxan, Taxol x12, 1 year hercepton .... Majors concerns with the femara anti-estrogen drug.. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Summer Heat and Chemotherapy sandrav Shrek4

Posts.Content: Aug 15, 2012 04:28AM - edited Aug 15, 2012 04:28AM by sandrav Wow so sorry to hear, I have seen during my chemo women having to come back again. The waiting sucks. One good thing that the nurse told me about having HER2 is that they know how to target it with treatment, where other types sometimes they are just guessing. My ongoligist said that 10 years ago they would have sent me home without treatment after my double massectomy ( Which I just wanted them gone, bye bye..lol) nothing in the nodes. Now they are being VERY aggressive. There is a HER2 message board just type that in your search engine. Your going to fight now just as you did before and get through this. Take it from your HER2 sister. Please keep us updated.
Posts.Title: .weird dx I think anamerty anamerty

Posts.Content: Oct 27, 2012 02:45PM sandrav wrote: Hello, I was diagnosed this last Christmas as I felt a lump too, but it was clearly seen via and ultra sound. My sister and niece both felt a lump and were freaked out now knowing that we have breast cancer in my family they both had several tests done. There lumps came out negitive! I am glad your doctor is being precousous and making sure that its all ok,please keep us updated.
Posts.Title: Lump felt but not seen on U/S, Doc sending me to breast surgeon kmansfield sandrav

Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2012 11:00PM sandrav wrote: I am an addiction counselor and if you take something like ambien every third night of not sleeping you should be ok and not become depended . I am not sure if you can use melatonin ( which is a natural chemical to tell your body to sleep ) ask your doctor. I take ambien and the xanax as Ruth mentioned it is hard enough going through this treatment, we need our rest.
Posts.Title: CAN NOT SLEEP...UGH!!!! lanagraves Makratz

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2012 05:33AM sandrav wrote: This is surley a shock to all who love you they want to help you but can not, but this is not about them.. this is about you allowing yourself to feel and may sometimes loose it. It is ok to loose it as it is a whirl wind of information all at once. Your worn out by all of the tests, dr. appts , looking into mastectomy / reconstruction  maybe chemo. Hoping each Dr. is leading you in the right direction. Its overwhelming at times.  You have a strong good outlook and will need that to get through what is ahead. Just remember you will get through this, and you don't need to be strong for others, you need to be strong for yourself.  I am coming to the end of what is ahead for you, it sounds like you have a wonderful supportive family that needs to find their inner strength to support you.
